title: Derivatives and Chain Rule
content: The chain rule is fundamental for finding derivatives of composite functions. If f(x) = g(h(x)), then f'(x) = g'(h(x)) · h'(x). Remember to work from outside to inside when applying the chain rule.

title: Integration Techniques
content: Key integration techniques: 1) Substitution method - useful when derivative of inner function appears, 2) Integration by parts - when product of functions, use formula ∫udv = uv - ∫vdu, 3) Partial fractions - for rational functions

title: Piaget's Cognitive Development Theory
content: Four stages: 1) Sensorimotor (0-2 years) - object permanence develops, 2) Preoperational (2-7 years) - symbolic thinking, egocentrism, 3) Concrete Operational (7-11 years) - logical thinking about concrete objects, 4) Formal Operational (11+ years) - abstract reasoning

title: Classical vs Operant Conditioning
content: Classical conditioning: learning through association (Pavlov's dogs). Operant conditioning: learning through consequences. Reinforcement increases behavior, punishment decreases it. Positive = adding stimulus, negative = removing stimulus.

title: Essay Structure and Thesis Statements
content: Strong thesis statement: 1) Takes a clear position, 2) Is specific and focused, 3) Can be argued/debated, 4) Appears in introduction. Essay structure: Introduction with thesis, body paragraphs with topic sentences and evidence, conclusion that reinforces thesis.

title: MLA Citation Format
content: In-text citations: (Author Page). Works Cited format: Author Last, First. "Title." Publication, Date, URL. For multiple authors, use 'and' between names. Indent second line of each citation.

title: Big O Notation
content: Describes algorithm efficiency: O(1) constant, O(log n) logarithmic, O(n) linear, O(n log n) linearithmic, O(n²) quadratic, O(2^n) exponential. Focus on worst-case scenario and drop constants/lower-order terms.

title: Database Normalization
content: 1NF: Atomic values, unique rows. 2NF: 1NF + no partial dependencies. 3NF: 2NF + no transitive dependencies. BCNF: 3NF + every determinant is a candidate key. Goal: reduce redundancy and update anomalies.

title: Causes of World War I
content: MAIN causes: Militarism (arms race), Alliances (Triple Alliance vs Triple Entente), Imperialism (competition for colonies), Nationalism (ethnic tensions in Balkans). Immediate trigger: assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo.

title: Industrial Revolution Timeline
content: 1760-1840: First Industrial Revolution - steam power, textiles, iron. 1840-1870: Railroad age, steel production. 1870-1914: Second Industrial Revolution - electricity, chemicals, automobiles. Key inventions: spinning jenny, steam engine, telegraph.
